com.google.android.agera

Interface Observable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MutableRepository<T>, Repository<T>, Reservoir<T>, UpdateDispatcher
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseObservable

    public interface Observable
    Notifies added Updatables when something happens.

    Addition and removal of Updatables has to be balanced. Multiple add of the same Updatable is not allowed and shall result in an IllegalStateException. Removing non-added Updatables shall also result in an IllegalStateException. Forgetting to remove an Updatable may result in memory/resource leaks.

    Without any Updatables added an Observable may temporarily be inactive. Observable implementations that provide values, perhaps through a Supplier, do not guarantee an up to date value when inactive. In order to ensure that the Observable is active, add an Updatable.

    Added Updatables shall be called back on the same thread they were added from.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addUpdatable(Updatable updatable)
      Adds updatable to the Observable.
      void removeUpdatable(Updatable updatable)
      Removes updatable from the Observable.

    • Method Detail

      • addUpdatable

        void addUpdatable(Updatable updatable)
        Adds updatable to the Observable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Updatable was already added or if it was called from a non-Looper thread

      • removeUpdatable

        void removeUpdatable(Updatable updatable)
        Removes updatable from the Observable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Updatable was not added
